     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f38aef0 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f38aef0" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-77d58fe ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="77d58fe">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-ba96553 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="ba96553" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            Wroclaw University of Science and Technology, as the first university in Poland ever, coordinates the EU Erasmus Joint Master Degree program (EMJM). The “
            <b>
             <span lang="EN-US">
              Sustainable Biomass and Bioproducts Engineering
             </span>
            </b>
            ” (SBBE) program is coordinated by Prof. Jolanta Warchoł from the Faculty of Chemistry.
           </p>
           <p>
            The EMJM-SBBE is the 2 years (4 semesters) program in the field of chemical engineering. It  corresponds to 120 ECTS credits. Each recruited student (18-22 people/year) will be getting a scholarship (
            <strong>
             1400 EUR/month
            </strong>
            ) for the whole period of study.
           </p>
           <p>
            <span lang="EN-US">
             Students who have already benefited from an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (EMJM) scholarship are not eligible to apply for an additional scholarship.
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            The program is realized at 3 Full Higher Education Institution Partners from 3 European Union countries: Wroclaw University of Science and Technology (WUST) Poland, University of Castilla-La Mancha (UCLM) Spain, Lappeenranta-Lahti University of Technology (LUT) Finland.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-a26e4c9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-video" data-element_type="widget" data-id="a26e4c9" data-settings='{"youtube_url":"https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=Jol_NarMykQ","video_type":"youtube","controls":"yes"}' data-widget_type="video.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="elementor-wrapper elementor-open-inline">
            <div class="elementor-video">
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-0abe127 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="0abe127">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-adc78b5 elementor-widget elementor-widget-image" data-element_type="widget" data-id="adc78b5" data-widget_type="image.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <a data-e-action-hash="#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dlightbox%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6NTE2MywidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6XC9cL2Vtam0tc2JiZS5ldVwvd3AtY29udGVudFwvdXBsb2Fkc1wvMjAyMlwvMDVcL2V1cm9wZS1wYXJ0bmVycy1tYXAuanBnIn0%3D" data-elementor-lightbox-title="europe-partners-map" data-elementor-open-lightbox="yes" href="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map.jpg">
            <img alt="" class="attachment-full size-full wp-image-5163" decoding="async" height="1500" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 1500px) 100vw, 1500px" src="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map.jpg" srcset="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map.jpg 1500w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map-300x300.jpg 300w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map-1024x1024.jpg 1024w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map-150x150.jpg 150w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map-768x768.jpg 768w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/europe-partners-map-720x720.jpg 720w" width="1500"/>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-6073fa1 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="6073fa1">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-59b7380 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="59b7380">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-0237a98 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="0237a98" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h3>
            SBBE graduates are prepared to design, develop and implement process’ technologies and solutions for the sustainable utilization of renewable resources. They also learn how to manufacture biobased products, including biofuels, bioenergy, biochemicals, bioplastics, paper, building materials, biocomposites, and about their applications.
           </h3>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-6314287 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="6314287" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h3>
            The new EMJM program includes:
           </h3>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-836b8b7 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="836b8b7">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-97b25c3 ot-column-items-center ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="97b25c3" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-4cdd1de elementor-widget elementor-widget-spacer" data-element_type="widget" data-id="4cdd1de" data-widget_type="spacer.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="elementor-spacer">
            <div class="elementor-spacer-inner">
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-2f806b9 ot-column-items-center ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="2f806b9" data-settings='{"background_background":"gradient"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-1c7b4a4 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="1c7b4a4" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            FORMAL EDUCATION
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-b1eb496 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="b1eb496" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            covers scheduled lectures and seminars – theoretical knowledge transfer. However, the greatest emphasis is put on practical process design and laboratory classes. We focus on knowledge, skills and attitudes building on chemistry of materials, biomaterials fabrication and characterization; fundamentals, design and optimization of bioprocesses; climate change and sustainable development. Special attention is paid to rural development – sustainable farming; management of natural resources, soil protection; bio-agriculture; sustainable transport modes; developing sectorial strategies and methodologies – how to save resources, reduce energy use and waste.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-00a85e6 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="00a85e6">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-aa1c553 ot-column-items-center ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="aa1c553" data-settings='{"background_background":"gradient"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-84baa1b elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="84baa1b" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            INFORMAL EDUCATION
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-20a273b elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="20a273b" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            covers activities organized with the local communities (any of academic, cultural and social) such as study visits in the Roztoczański National Park. This allows students to familiarize with non-specialists’ opinion about green energy production, biomass and wastewater utilization in a frame of circular economy, sustainable natural water use. We also envisage building the sense of belonging by organizing additional joint social and cultural activities such as: trips to important historic, cultural and regional/local environmental spots; joint sport activities (e.g. mountain hiking); social events (e.g. international events held in the host city). A visit to Verla mill museum (Kouvola, Finland), a UNESCO World Heritage site, introduces the history and early pulping technology. Informal education also covers meetings with ecologists to allow students be updated with the current environmental friendly trends.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-d31f7d1 ot-column-items-center ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="d31f7d1" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-de2fe93 elementor-widget elementor-widget-spacer" data-element_type="widget" data-id="de2fe93" data-widget_type="spacer.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="elementor-spacer">
            <div class="elementor-spacer-inner">
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-76b3e30 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="76b3e30">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">

        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-44d3f72 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="44d3f72" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            NON-FORMAL EDUCATION
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-acf8c24 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="acf8c24" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            provides additional educational activities beyond the main study program: Polish, Spanish, or Finnish language classes, workshops, summer schools, participation in additional scientific events taking place at the partner universities e.g. open scientific days, students’ conferences, lectures with invited scientists and experts from industry.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            The teaching program of the joint SBBE master program leads to the award of MSc degree from each partner institution as well as SBBE certificate.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-b709b17 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="b709b17" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>

                <article class="elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-8608 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news">

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="elementor elementor-5434" data-elementor-id="5434" data-elementor-post-type="page" data-elementor-type="wp-page">
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f38aef0 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f38aef0" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-0abe127 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="0abe127">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-cca24a9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="cca24a9" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            About the program
           </h2>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-318ca3c ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="318ca3c" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-845e07a ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="845e07a">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-678e4d7 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="678e4d7" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            The project aim is to provide excellent quality and innovative EMJM programme to increase the attractiveness of the European Higher Education Area by internationalization of the education.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-88f4324 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="88f4324" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-3337294 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="3337294">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-cdf6831 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="cdf6831" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Teaching objectives:
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-dabe894 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="dabe894" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             01
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-star">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              The first objective
             </h5>
             <p>
              is to train scientists-engineers able to design and develop sustainable technologies for biomass conversion/treatment and bio-products/bio-materials processing. The received level of training should allow them to continue with PhD programs all over the world or to work as leaders in the new developing industry.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-1f79c91 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="1f79c91" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             02
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-star">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              The second objective
             </h5>
             <p>
              is to promote excellence, innovation, mobility, diversity as well as complementarities of European Universities and Research Laboratories. This Master program has a unique chance to define a new way of teaching in bio-based products and processes engineering domains in Europe.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-ce53bce elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="ce53bce" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             03
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-star">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              The third objective
             </h5>
             <p>
              is to bring highly-motivated third-country students to Europe as well as to provide to European students options in international academic training. The SBBE Master Program Consortium gives to its students a unique chance to interact closely with  professors during classes and thesis work. Our rich scientific (Summer School, Invited Scholars) and cultural (European heritage-oriented program) activities are aiming at this goal.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

           <div class="ot-heading">
            <h4 class="main-heading">
             Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
            </h4>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-2f41c2d ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="2f41c2d">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-fca4a2b ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="fca4a2b">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-cf6ca90 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="cf6ca90" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h6 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters SBBE scholarships for Visiting Scholars are destined for experts of recognized excellence to bring added value to the SBBE program
           </h6>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-c22e6ec elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="c22e6ec" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            They will be
            <strong>
             selected by the SBBE Evaluation Committee
            </strong>
            based on excellence and on the Consortium’s needs in relation to the specific topic of expertise.
           </p>
           <p>
            Invited Scholar is obliged to:
           </p>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Commit themselves to actively support the Master’s course
            </li>
            <li>
             Spend a minimum of one week and a maximum of two weeks at the SBBE Partner Institution
            </li>
            <li>
             Bring concrete added value to the course and for students through teaching of specific classes, leading and participating in seminars or workshops, monitoring and tutoring student research/project activities, participating in thesis reviews, preparing new teaching modules, etc.
            </li>
            <li>
             Contribute, after their visiting scholar activities, to the promotion and dissemination of the EMJM Programme in general, and the SBBE concerned in particular
            </li>
           </ul>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-87cfc5d ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="87cfc5d">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-77889d7 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="77889d7">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-7deddb7 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="7deddb7" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h6 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Invited scholars will be offered a scholarship based on the scholarship agreement
           </h6>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-0fd7174 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="0fd7174" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             02
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-star">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
             </h5>
             <p>
              The amount of the scholarship is up to 1500 EUR for the first week for the Scholar coming from EU or up to 2000 EUR for the first week for the Scholars coming from outside EU. For the second week the Scholar is paid 1000 EUR.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-fed5ba3 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="fed5ba3" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             01
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-star">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
             </h5>
             <p>
              The minimal period of visits is 1 week and maximum 2 weeks. A ‘week’ is defined as minimum 4 working days (including travelling day) out of 7 consecutive calendar days. It is not possible to consider 8 consecutive days as 2 weeks.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-73cfffe elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="73cfffe" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            The Consortium favors on-site activities, however, in the event of COVID-19 restrictions, online activities are eligible. The host university will transfer the scholarship until the last day of planned activities to the Visiting Scholar’s bank account.
           </p>
           <p>
            Invited lecturers will also have access to the facilities of the host universities (library, sports facilities, computer rooms, etc.).
           </p>
           <p>
            The University will not cover the insurance cost during the term of the Agreement. Visiting Scholar will have to cover it by him /herself.
           </p>
           <p>
            CV and a proposal of the scholarship activities (1 page) identifying the Applicant possible contribution to SBBE project should be send by email to the SBBE coordinator Jolanta WARCHOL at email
            <a href="mailto:jolanta.warchol@pwr.edu.pl">
             jolanta.warchol@pwr.edu.pl
            </a>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-1ad5924 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="1ad5924">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">

            </span>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="elementor elementor-5475" data-elementor-id="5475" data-elementor-post-type="page" data-elementor-type="wp-page">
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f38aef0 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f38aef0" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-0abe127 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="0abe127">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-cca24a9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="cca24a9" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Admission process
           </h2>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-318ca3c ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="318ca3c" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-845e07a ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="845e07a">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-678e4d7 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="678e4d7" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            All eligible applications are evaluated and ranked by the Consortium’s Selection Committee with a maximum score of 50 points according to the following criteria:
           </p>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Grades Average of academic results of the student within his/her classes.
             <strong>
              <br/>
             </strong>
            </li>
            <li>
             Adequacy of the student’s background (academic courses) for the SBBE program.
             <strong>
              <br/>
             </strong>
            </li>
            <li>
             Relevance of merits associated with the CV.
            </li>
           </ul>
           <p>
            The admission policy is intended to ensure equal opportunity of access to higher education for qualified European and Third-country students. In the first instance the Selection Committee selects those students who meet the Admission Requirements and afterwards establishes a ranking considering merits. Then shortlisted 50 candidates are invited for an on-line interview. Finally, the Committee prepares the list of candidates selected for SBBE scholarship as well as the reserve list.
           </p>
           <p>
            The candidates from both lists are informed accordingly by e-mail by the SBBE the project manager. The candidates selected for SBBE scholarship must confirm their participation in the program within one week.
           </p>
           <p>
            After the decision of the selection is communicated, applicant has the possibility to appeal against it to the Consortium Selection Committee (
            <a href="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/sbbe_appeal_form.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
             procedure and appeal form
            </a>
            ).
           </p>
           <p>
            Students who benefited from any other Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (EMJM) scholarship in the past are not eligible to apply for the SBBE scholarship.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-810115f elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="810115f" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h4 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            CALL FOR APPLICATIONS
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-334c273 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="334c273" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            The call for the academic year  2025/2026
            <strong>
             <span style="color: #ff0000;">
              is now closed.
             </span>
            </strong>
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </div>

                            const [k, v] = s.split('=')
                            return Object.assign(acc, {[k]: v})
                        }, {})

                        const url = "https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-json/apvc/track_view"
                        const body = {
                            utm_source: params.utm_source,
                            utm_medium: params.utm_medium,

                            ...{"rawData":{"type":"singular","singular_id":5475,"author_id":0,"page":1},"signature":"95ec2b866bcbcc05751726af1f34faa0"}                        }
                        const xhr = new XMLHttpRequest()

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f38aef0 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f38aef0" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-0abe127 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="0abe127">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-cca24a9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="cca24a9" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Selection criteria
           </h2>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-318ca3c ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="318ca3c" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-845e07a ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="845e07a">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-10328a7 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="10328a7" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h4 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            The SBBE Master’s degree is designed to provid a high-quality training and to enable students achieve qualifications in the field of chemical engineering combined with bioprocessing.
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-e02eb98 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="e02eb98">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-f4c3b7b ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="f4c3b7b">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-8200ee5 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="8200ee5">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-1a8761a ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="1a8761a">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-43ce620 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="43ce620" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h4 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            The minimum requirements for admission to the master are:
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-dcdfe48 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="dcdfe48" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             01
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              1. Strong academic background in appropriate disciplines
             </h5>
             <p>
              The SBBE Programme is open to excellent European and non-European students having acquired a BSc (or higher) equivalent diploma in Chemical, Environmental, and Mechanical Engineering, or in related fields.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              Degree must give applicant eligibility to apply to a university Master’s studies in the country where the degree was completed.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              If a candidate is in a process of obtaining the Bachelor degree, applicant can yet apply for the admission. In this case, applicant has to provide a letter signed by the university stating the expected date of the BSc title obtainment as well as a detailed transcript of records.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-9e1b8a3 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="9e1b8a3" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             02
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              2. Demonstrated English language skills
             </h5>
             <p>
              Candidates must demonstrate  knowledge of English by proving proof of her/his education in English (secondary school diploma and/or bachelor degree) or by proving a certified language level equivalent to at least B2 according to CEFR (Common European Framework of Reference for Languages), for example:
              <br/>
              <br/>
              - TOEFL test: minimum score 78 (210 computer-based/547 paper-basedtest).
              <br/>
              - ELTS test: minimum score 6.0, at least 5.7 on each sub-score (Academic test and not the General one!).
              <br/>
              - Cambridge International Examinations: FCE level B2 with minimum score 72.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              Not mandatory for students of the following nationalities: USA, UK, Ireland, New Zealand and Australia.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-fd829cc elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="fd829cc" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             03
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              3. Rules from European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA)
             </h5>
             <p>
              Candidates have to provide
              <br/>
              <br/>
              - A residence certificate issued in accordance with the candidate’s municipality standard registration rules;
              <br/>
              or
              <br/>
              - A certificate from the candidate’s place of work, study or training issued by the employer or institution in question.
              <br/>
              <br/>
              The document must have been issued within 12 months before the SBBE student scholarship's submission deadline, i.e. the Consortium’s official deadline for student selection.
             </p>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f38aef0 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f38aef0" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-0abe127 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="0abe127">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-cca24a9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="cca24a9" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Self-Funded Students
           </h2>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-88f4324 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="88f4324" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-3337294 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="3337294">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-0c1132c elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="0c1132c" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            The SBBE program opens the possibility for free of charge (no tuition fees) participation for Self-Funded Students (SFS).
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-f597f4d elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="f597f4d" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            A SFS will
            <strong>
             not get a scholarship
            </strong>
            . So, he/she needs to cover the expenses of travel, living and accommodation in Poland (1
            <sup>
             st
            </sup>
            semester), Spain (2
            <sup>
             nd
            </sup>
            semester), and Finland (3
            <sup>
             rd
            </sup>
            semester).
           </p>
           <p>
            SFS does
            <strong>
             not need to attend all the SBBE courses
            </strong>
            if a candidate already completed corresponding courses in the past.
           </p>
           <p>
            The successful completion of the curriculum of EMJM SBBE MSc program will be rewarded by three national MSc diplomas, from Poland, Spain and Finland.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-07b5675 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="07b5675" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-8ea6236 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="8ea6236">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-f817ccb elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="f817ccb" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Self-funded and scholarship students benefits comparison:
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-0836c95 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="0836c95">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-b7b0c11 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="b7b0c11" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-8558333 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="8558333" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h6 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Scholarship
           </h6>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-3f3cbb3 elementor-align-left elementor-icon-list--layout-traditional elementor-list-item-link-full_width elementor-widget elementor-widget-icon-list" data-element_type="widget" data-id="3f3cbb3" data-widget_type="icon-list.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <ul class="elementor-icon-list-items">
            <li class="elementor-icon-list-item">
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-icon">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-check-circle">
              </i>
             </span>
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-text">
              Medical insurance including medical expenses, physical accidents, permanent disablement, civil liability, and material damages
             </span>
            </li>
            <li class="elementor-icon-list-item">
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-icon">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-check-circle">
              </i>
             </span>
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-text">
              Free access to all activities envisaged in the program (summer school, study visits to industry, cultural and sports activities, etc.)
             </span>
            </li>
            <li class="elementor-icon-list-item">
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-icon">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-check-circle">
              </i>
             </span>
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-text">
              Free access to universities’ e-systems and chemical laboratories
             </span>
            </li>
            <li class="elementor-icon-list-item">
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-icon">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-check-circle">
              </i>
             </span>
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-text">
              Administration support
             </span>
            </li>
            <li class="elementor-icon-list-item">
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-icon">
              <i aria-hidden="true" class="fas fa-check-circle">
              </i>
             </span>
             <span class="elementor-icon-list-text">
              Access to accommodation in a student dormitory (charged as other students)

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

                            const [k, v] = s.split('=')
                            return Object.assign(acc, {[k]: v})
                        }, {})

                        const url = "https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-json/apvc/track_view"
                        const body = {
                            utm_source: params.utm_source,
                            utm_medium: params.utm_medium,
                            utm_campaign: params.utm_campaign,
                            utm_term: params.utm_term,

                            ...{"rawData":{"type":"singular","singular_id":6584,"author_id":0,"page":1},"signature":"982f53ea6b41f44c8cdde3c3cab761c9"}                        }
                        const xhr = new XMLHttpRequest()
                        xhr.open("POST", url, true)

                        xhr.send(JSON.stringify(body))

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f38aef0 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f38aef0" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-318ca3c ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="318ca3c" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-845e07a ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="845e07a">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-2da675a elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="2da675a" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h4 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Modules with corresponding ECTS provided by
            <font color="#D70000">
             WUST,
            </font>
            <font color="#00a746">
             UCLM,
            </font>
            and
            <font color="#0070C0">
             LUT
            </font>
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-c04eb8b elementor-widget elementor-widget-image" data-element_type="widget" data-id="c04eb8b" data-widget_type="image.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <a data-e-action-hash="#elementor-action%3Aaction%3Dlightbox%26settings%3DeyJpZCI6NjgzNiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6XC9cL2Vtam0tc2JiZS5ldVwvd3AtY29udGVudFwvdXBsb2Fkc1wvMjAyMlwvMDlcL3RhYmVsa2EtU0JCRS1jb3Vyc2VzLXByb2dyYW0tc2NhbGVkLmpwZyJ9" data-elementor-lightbox-title="tabelka--SBBE-courses-program" data-elementor-open-lightbox="yes" href="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-scaled.jpg">
            <img alt="" class="attachment-full size-full wp-image-6836" data-pagespeed-url-hash="71144693" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="773" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 2560px) 100vw, 2560px" src="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-scaled.jpg" srcset="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-scaled.jpg 2560w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-300x91.jpg 300w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-1024x309.jpg 1024w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-768x232.jpg 768w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-1536x464.jpg 1536w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-2048x618.jpg 2048w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/tabelka-SBBE-courses-program-720x217.jpg 720w" width="2560">
            </img>

      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-115066b ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="115066b">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-24db34c ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="24db34c">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-2d4302c elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="2d4302c" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h4 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            All modules target some specific skills and expertise to be acquired:
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-7984a35 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="7984a35" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             01
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              1. BIO-BASED MATERIALS module
             </h5>
             <p>
              The group of lectures in Sem 1: Bio-based composites and polymers + Synthesis and fabrication of biobased materials + Microorganisms in synthesis, give the basis of biomaterials composition and synthesis methodology, while group of laboratory practice: Molecular analysis and Optimization of bio-based materials + Instrumental analysis of biomaterials’ structural and chemical properties + Thermogravimetry for oxy-combustion analysis, give the opportunity to acquire analytical skills in the preparation of samples, the ability to operate the advance instrumental equipment and most importantly experience in analysis of data obtained.  The UCLM partner supports this module in Sem 2 in the course related to fabrication by the production of polymers directly from naturally occurring compounds or from bio-based materials. The LUT partner in Sem 3 gives technological course focuses on bio-based materials processing and applications in e.g. food packaging and textile fibrous materials.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-dfa334d elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="dfa334d" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             02
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              2. BIO-PRODUCT PROCESSES module
             </h5>
             <p>
              This module refers to design of processes and technologies for the sustainable manufacture of bioproducts (materials, chemicals and energy) from renewable biological resources. In Sem 1 the WUST partner provides lectures and laboratory on Biochemical unit operations and reactors. In Sem 2, the UCLM partner provides the group of lectures: Bioprocesses design + Bioprocesses simulation by AspenHysys and AspenPlus + Dynamic and control of bioprocesses, laboratory/bench scale work with a technical focus on methodology of numerical design and optimization of the processes, process control and industrial measurement. In Sem 3 the LUT provides the course on development of new sustainable bio-products processes focusing on implementation, pilot scale demonstration and case studies in the field application.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-46491e6 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="46491e6" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             03
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              3. BIOREFINERIES module
             </h5>
             <p>
              In Sem 1 the WUST partner provides the theoretical basis and laboratory practice on Chemical-thermal biomass conversion processes + Biomass treatment, purification and modification to be marketed as biofuel. In Sem 2 the UCLM partner provides the group of lectures related to engineering aspects of different unit operation involved in the Production of biofuels (including lab-synthesis of biodiesel, bioethanol, biogas and waste biomass pyrolysis). In Sem 3, the LUT partner provides a course on Lignocellulosic biorefineries detailing current (e.g. Kraft pulping) and emerging (e.g. organosolv processes) large-scale processes employing lignocellulose as the raw material. The course includes a site visit to an industrial biorefinery. Course on Separation technology in biorefining implements a problem-based learning approach to develop the students engineering analysis and design skills in the context of separation unit operations.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-50234dd elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="50234dd" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             04
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              4. SUSTAINABLE BIOBASED BUSINESS module
             </h5>
             <p>
              The courses on Biobased economy + Recycling of materials + SigmaPro Lab gives fundamentals of circular economy and introduces the methodology of conversion of resources, residues, by-products and side streams into value added products. Good laboratory practice course familiarizes students with safety, consistency, high quality, and reliability of chemicals in laboratory. Group of lectures on Material and energy valorisation of waste in a circular economy introduces the methodology of the valorisation of the biomass/biogenic fraction of waste into different bioenergy products (heat, power cooling, liquid and gaseous biofuels) as well as production of renewable chemicals. The courses on Project management tools for biomarket + Economic assessment + Business model (General rules, Canvas, DAFO) targeting on sustainable bio-economy related to sustainable economic development on issues such as climate warming and fossil resources, natural resource scarcity, biomass competition, biodiversity, waste streams, governance, social well-being.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-996d603 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="996d603" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             05
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              5. PRACTICAL SKILLS module
             </h5>
             <p>
              The goal of this module is to guide novice students towards effective research methodology by helping them gaining a clear understanding of a research structure as well as familiarise them with current trends in scientific data analysis. After finishing this set of courses, graduates will be capable of participating in applied research projects, designing and building assessment instruments, analysing and interpreting data, and translating research findings for application to educational settings.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-c42e711 elementor-widget elementor-widget-iservice_box" data-element_type="widget" data-id="c42e711" data-widget_type="iservice_box.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="service-box s-box">
            <span class="big-number">
             06
            </span>
            <div class="icon-main">
             <i aria-hidden="true" class="far fa-check-circle">
             </i>
            </div>
            <div class="content-box">
             <h5>
              6. ADDITIONAL COURSES module
             </h5>
             <p>
              Compulsory sport classes as at every level of study as beneficial for students' health and a way to create good relationships between students; philosophical classes playing important role in clarification of scientific concepts and theories, critical assessment of scientific assumptions or methods, and fostering of dialogue between science and society; language skills as the tool of modern communication. In parallel, students learn basics of the local languages to easy adaptation in different countries and assimilation with local student community.
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </div>
   </div>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   (function () {
                    document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function (e) {
                        if (document.hasOwnProperty("visibilityState") && document.visibilityState === "prerender") {
                            return;

                            return;
                        }

                        const params = location.search.slice(1).split('&').reduce((acc, s) => {
                            const [k, v] = s.split('=')
                            return Object.assign(acc, {[k]: v})
                        }, {})

                        const url = "https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-json/apvc/track_view"
                        const body = {
                            utm_source: params.utm_source,
                            utm_medium: params.utm_medium,
                            utm_campaign: params.utm_campaign,
                            utm_term: params.utm_term,
                            utm_content: params.utm_content,
                            ...{"rawData":{"type":"singular","singular_id":6642,"author_id":0,"page":1},"signature":"81186c35be8376472d7ea89389d83358"}                        }
                        const xhr = new XMLHttpRequest()
                        xhr.open("POST", url, true)
                        xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "application/json;charset=UTF-8")
                        xhr.send(JSON.stringify(body))
                    })
                })();
