  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-f38aef0 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="f38aef0" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-77d58fe ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="77d58fe">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-ba96553 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="ba96553" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            Wroclaw University of Science and Technology, as the first university in Poland ever, coordinates the EU Erasmus Joint Master Degree program (EMJM). The “
            <b>
             <span lang="EN-US">
              Sustainable Biomass and Bioproducts Engineering
             </span>
            </b>
            ” (SBBE) program is coordinated by Prof. Jolanta Warchoł from the Faculty of Chemistry.
           </p>
           <p>
            The EMJM-SBBE is the 2 years (4 semesters) program in the field of chemical engineering. It  corresponds to 120 ECTS credits. Each recruited student (18-22 people/year) will be getting a scholarship (
            <strong>
             1400 EUR/month
            </strong>
            ) for the whole period of study.
           </p>
           <p>
            <span lang="EN-US">
             Students who have already benefited from an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master (EMJM) scholarship are not eligible to apply for an additional scholarship.
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            The program is realized at 3 Full Higher Education Institution Partners from 3 European Union countries: Wroclaw University of Science and Technology (WUST) Poland, University of Castilla-La Mancha (UCLM) Spain, Lappeenranta-Lahti University of Technology (LUT) Finland.
           </p>

      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">

         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-0237a98 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="0237a98" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h3>
            SBBE graduates are prepared to design, develop and implement process’ technologies and solutions for the sustainable utilization of renewable resources. They also learn how to manufacture biobased products, including biofuels, bioenergy, biochemicals, bioplastics, paper, building materials, biocomposites, and about their applications.
           </h3>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-6314287 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="6314287" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h3>
            The new EMJM program includes:
           </h3>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-836b8b7 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="836b8b7">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-97b25c3 ot-column-items-center ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="97b25c3" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-4cdd1de elementor-widget elementor-widget-spacer" data-element_type="widget" data-id="4cdd1de" data-widget_type="spacer.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <div class="elementor-spacer">
            <div class="elementor-spacer-inner">
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-2f806b9 ot-column-items-center ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="2f806b9" data-settings='{"background_background":"gradient"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-1c7b4a4 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="1c7b4a4" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            FORMAL EDUCATION
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-b1eb496 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="b1eb496" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            covers scheduled lectures and seminars – theoretical knowledge transfer. However, the greatest emphasis is put on practical process design and laboratory classes. We focus on knowledge, skills and attitudes building on chemistry of materials, biomaterials fabrication and characterization; fundamentals, design and optimization of bioprocesses; climate change and sustainable development. Special attention is paid to rural development – sustainable farming; management of natural resources, soil protection; bio-agriculture; sustainable transport modes; developing sectorial strategies and methodologies – how to save resources, reduce energy use and waste.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-00a85e6 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="00a85e6">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-50 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-aa1c553 ot-column-items-center ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="aa1c553" data-settings='{"background_background":"gradient"}'>
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-84baa1b elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="84baa1b" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h5 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            INFORMAL EDUCATION
           </h5>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-20a273b elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="20a273b" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            covers activities organized with the local communities (any of academic, cultural and social) such as study visits in the Roztoczański National Park. This allows students to familiarize with non-specialists’ opinion about green energy production, biomass and wastewater utilization in a frame of circular economy, sustainable natural water use. We also envisage building the sense of belonging by organizing additional joint social and cultural activities such as: trips to important historic, cultural and regional/local environmental spots; joint sport activities (e.g. mountain hiking); social events (e.g. international events held in the host city). A visit to Verla mill museum (Kouvola, Finland), a UNESCO World Heritage site, introduces the history and early pulping technology. Informal education also covers meetings with ecologists to allow students be updated with the current environmental friendly trends.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

           <p>
            <strong>
             List of students Halls:
            </strong>
           </p>
           <ul>
            <li>
             Residencia Universitaria José Maestro. Address: C/ Juan Ramón Jiménez, 6.
            </li>
            <li>
             Residencia el Doncel. Address: Ronda del parque, 32. E-mail runidoncel@jccm.es
            </li>
            <li>
             Residencia Universitaria José Castillejo. Address: C/ Pozo Concejo, 8.
            </li>
            <li>
             Residencia Universitaria Don Quijote. Address: C/ Juan Ramón Jiménez, 2.
            </li>
            <li>
             Residencia Religiosas de María Inmaculada. Address: Calle Caballeros, 12.
            </li>
            <li>
             Residencia Universitaria Ágora. Address: C/ Cuadras, 20. E-mail: agoraresidencia@hotmail.com
            </li>
            <li>
             Residencia Felipe II. C/ Inmaculada Concepción 12. E-mail: info@residenciauniversitariafelipeii.com
             <strong>
              <br/>
             </strong>
            </li>

          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-6016f76 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="6016f76" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            Contact the local coordinator for help with resident halls accommodation. If this is your choice, the booking must be done during September.
           </p>
           <p>
            There is also the possibility of living in shared flats. In this case, contact with the Office for International Relationships in case of needing assistance:
            <a href="mailto:ori.cr@uclm.es">
             ori.cr@uclm.es
            </a>
            or +34 926 295320.
           </p>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-01fc845 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="01fc845">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-b6619ac ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="b6619ac">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-eef7d1d elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="eef7d1d" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h4 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            LUT, Lahti, Finland
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-68409af elementor-widget__width-initial elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="68409af" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h3>
            <span style="color: #0070c0;">
             Housing
            </span>
           </h3>
           <p>
            Lahden Talot (
            <a href="https://lahdentalot.fi/asunto/opiskelija-asunnot/">
             https://lahdentalot.fi/asunto/opiskelija-asunnot/
            </a>
            ) offers a wide range of housing for students in various parts of the city. Student housing is located either right next to the campus or in the city centre and in the surrounding areas of the city centre, but always along good transport connections.
           </p>
           <p>
            In Lahti, everyone starting their studies is guaranteed residence. Most of the student flats are studios, but there are also shared flats, two-room flats and larger residences for families and group living.
           </p>
           <p>
            The rents for one-room flats are approximately 352–607 euros per month and the rents for rooms in shared flats are approximately 237–407 euros. The rent always includes Internet access, water, electricity and the use of a shared laundry room and sauna in the housing complex. The flats are firnished with basic staff.
           </p>
           <p>
            <i>
             When you arrive in Lahti, you will be met by your tutor – a senior student in Lahti. If needed, your tutor can help you to pick up your keys for your apartment in Lahden Talot in case you arrive outside the office hours. When you arrive in Lahti, you will be met by your tutor – a senior student in Lahti. Tutor’s help will be available between 8:00 in the morning and 24:00 midnight starting from 16th of August. Your tutor will help you with practical matters during your first days in Lahti and at LUT.
            </i>
           </p>
           <p>
            <i>
             You will receive your tutor’s contact information by e-mail in August before your departure for Finland. You will need to submit your arrival details well in advance for the tutor to be able to meet you in Lahti.
            </i>
           </p>
           <div>
           </div>
           <h3>
           </h3>
           <div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-89c4928 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="89c4928">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-2925120 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="2925120">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <section class="elementor-section elementor-inner-section elementor-element elementor-element-a1547e6 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="a1547e6">
          <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
           <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-inner-column elementor-element elementor-element-0cba211 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="0cba211">
            <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-a0c5e40 elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="a0c5e40" data-widget_type="heading.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <h4 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
                Spain, Aeropuerto Madrid-Barajas
               </h4>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-0a044d9 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="0a044d9" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
              <div class="elementor-widget-container">
               <div class="bus-lines__tabs">
                <div class="row">
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   <u>
                    First: travel from Barajas Airport to Atocha-Renfe train station
                   </u>
                  </strong>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  There are 4 ways to get from Barajas Airport to Atocha-Renfe train station:
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   By bus:
                  </strong>
                  the line 203 or Exprés Aeropuerto (Airport express) is the express line connecting the Atocha train station and the airport of Madrid-Barajas. Atocha bus stop (beginning/end of route) works only in daytime, 6:00h to 23:30h. Overnight, bus stop beginning/end of route is in central Madrid (Cibeles), and the bus is renamed as N27 Exprés Aeropuerto. More information (ticket price, schedules, …) at:
                  <a href="https://www.aeropuertomadrid-barajas.com/transportation/madrid-airport-bybus.htm">
                   https://www.aeropuertomadrid-barajas.com/transportation/madrid-airport-bybus.htm
                  </a>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   By metro:
                  </strong>
                  you need to take first LINE 8 to Nuevos Ministerios, then LINE 10 from Nuevos Ministerios to Tribunal and, finally, LINE 1 from Tribunal to Atocha-Renfe train station. More information at:
                  <a href="https://www.metromadrid.es/es">
                   https://www.metromadrid.es/es
                  </a>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   By local train “cercanías”:
                  </strong>
                  local train network service “Cercanías” C1 and C10 lines connect the airport with Atocha-Renfe Station. The train station is on the terminal 4 floor -1, and is called Aeropuerto T4. To move to the other terminals there is a shuttle bus service connecting the terminals. More information (ticket price, schedules, …) at:
                  <a href="https://www.aeropuertomadrid-barajas.com/transportation/madrid-airport-bytrain.htm">
                   https://www.aeropuertomadrid-barajas.com/transportation/madrid-airport-bytrain.htm
                  </a>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   By taxi:
                  </strong>
                  The price from the Madrid-Barajas airport to Atocha train station is a flat rate of 30€.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   <u>
                    Second: travel from Atocha-Renfe train station to Ciudad Real
                   </u>
                  </strong>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Trains from Atocha-Renfe train station to Ciudad Real can be acquired at:
                  <a href="https://www.renfe.com/es/en">
                   https://www.renfe.com/es/en
                  </a>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </section>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

<p><![endif]-->
               </p>
               <h3>
                <span lang="EN-US" style="color: #0070c0;">
                 How to get to Lappeenranta
                </span>
               </h3>
               <p>
                <b>
                 Airport
                </b>
               </p>
               <p>
                How to get to Lappeenranta and down should be replaced with the following:
               </p>
               <p>
                All international students are asked to send their arrival information (name, mobile phone number, arrival date and time, and means of transportation) to LUT Student Services (
                <a href="mailto:arrival@lut.fi">
                 arrival@lut.fi
                </a>
                ) no later than three weeks before the date of arrival. For this purpose, you will receive an arrival information form by e-mail during the summer.
               </p>
               <p>
                The Lappeenranta-Lahti University of Technology LUT is located in Lappeenranta and Lahti. The closest airport is Helsinki- Airport (
                <a href="https://www.finavia.fi/en/airports/helsinki-airport">
                 https://www.finavia.fi/en/airports/helsinki-airport
                </a>
                )
               </p>
               <p>
                The students arriving at Helsinki airport have several possibilities to go to Lahti Campus.
               </p>
               <p>
                <b>
                 By train:
                </b>
                Direct Express or Intercity as well as Commuter trains from Helsinki main Railway Station or Tikkurila to Lahti take an  hour. You can take a train also from Helsinki-Vantaa Airport. More info.: Welcome on a journey together with us – VR (
                <a href="https://www.vr.fi/en">
                 https://www.vr.fi/en
                </a>
                )
               </p>
               <p>
                <b>
                 By bus:
                </b>
                Express coaches from Helsinki:
                <a href="http://expressbus.fi/en">
                 expressbus.fi/en
                </a>
                <br/>
                Low-cost bus connections:
                <a href="http://onnibus.com/home">
                 onnibus.com/home
                </a>
                <br/>
                Note! All busses have their own departure places, remember to check the exact address
               </p>
               <p>
                <b>
                 By car:
                </b>
                Take motorway number 4 from Helsinki to Lahti (100 km).
               </p>
               <p>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];

    <div class="elementor elementor-6540" data-elementor-id="6540" data-elementor-post-type="page" data-elementor-type="wp-page">
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-2395576 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="2395576" data-settings='{"background_background":"classic"}'>
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-baf3403 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="baf3403">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-549d5ef elementor-widget elementor-widget-heading" data-element_type="widget" data-id="549d5ef" data-widget_type="heading.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h2 class="elementor-heading-title elementor-size-default">
            Graduation week
           </h2>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-e0e481a ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="e0e481a">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-ddabf82 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="ddabf82">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-5a61e57 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="5a61e57" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <p>
            The student from the cohort
            <em>
             n
            </em>
            and
            <em>
             n+2
            </em>
            meet in Wroclaw (POLAND) during the Invitation Week in September. New students have an opportunity to discuss with graduate students about the program experiences.
            <br/>
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Timeline for MSc students:
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
            1. Participation in the Opening Ceremony for new SBBE students’ intake (Monday during the Invitation Week). After the Opening Ceremony, there is a ‘get-together’ party to encourage students for integration.
           </p>
           <p>
            2. Participation in MSc defense in front of an international committee and a representative of external institution/company (Tuesday-Wednesday during the Invitation Week) –
            <u>
             closed event
            </u>
            .
            <br/>
           </p>
           <p>
           </p>
           <div>
            3. Participation in the Graduation Ceremony (Thursday during the Invitation Week)
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </div>
   </div>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

                            return Object.assign(acc, {[k]: v})

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

           <header class="entry-header">

            <!-- .entry-meta -->
            <h1 class="entry-title">
             Beginning of the semester in Spain
            </h1>
           </header>
           <!-- .entry-header -->
           <div class="entry-summary">
            <p>
             The third cohort just started their second semester within the SBBE programme. They left Poland at the end of January to now continue their education at UCLM in Spain.
             <br/>
             At the official reception students were welcomed by the Vice Rector and the Dean of Faculty of Chemistry. Later they got a chance to enjoy Ciudad Real during the city tour.
            </p>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

            <h1 class="entry-title">
             Safety and security classes in PCC Rokita
            </h1>
           </header>
           <!-- .entry-header -->
           <div class="entry-summary">
            <p>
             The SBBE 3rd cohort’s students visited PCC Rokita – chemical company that produces among others chlorine, oxygen, propylene, ethylene oxides and hydrogen for additives, polymer applications, etc. The company has a robust safety system to minimize the risk of industrial accidents and fatalities. The plant site is demarcated into various danger zones monitored by a wide net of detectors. The safety department provides workshops for employees and visitors regarding safety protocols, including wearing Personal Protective Clothing and Equipment.
            </p>
            <p>
             PCC Rokita has an advanced emergency stand 24/7 by the firefighting team. This unit has state-of-the-art fire-fighting equipment and fire trucks. The students participated in a special training dedicated for fire-fighters.
            </p>

                        const params = location.search.slice(1).split('&').reduce((acc, s) => {
                            const [k, v] = s.split('=')
                            return Object.assign(acc, {[k]: v})
                        }, {})

                        const url = "https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-json/apvc/track_view"
                        const body = {
                            utm_source: params.utm_source,
                            utm_medium: params.utm_medium,
                            utm_campaign: params.utm_campaign,
                            utm_term: params.utm_term,
                            utm_content: params.utm_content,
                            ...{"rawData":{"type":"singular","singular_id":8504,"author_id":0,"page":1},"signature":"5fc1ff5feee6aa6ee008163b9db9a374"}                        }
                        const xhr = new XMLHttpRequest()
                        xhr.open("POST", url, true)

                        xhr.send(JSON.stringify(body))

   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

              News
             </a>
            </span>
           </div>
           <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" data-pagespeed-url-hash="3046009094" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="1008" onload="pagespeed.CriticalImages.checkImageForCriticality(this);" sizes="(max-width: 1512px) 100vw, 1512px" src="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/sport-classes2a.jpg" srcset="https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/sport-classes2a.jpg 1512w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/sport-classes2a-300x200.jpg 300w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/sport-classes2a-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/sport-classes2a-768x512.jpg 768w, https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/sport-classes2a-720x480.jpg 720w" width="1512">

            <h1 class="entry-title">
             Weekend sports classes
            </h1>
           </header>
           <!-- .entry-header -->
           <div class="entry-summary">
            <p>
             On Saturday, January 18th, the students of the third cohort attended an ice skating session at Hala Orbita. This event provided a valuable fun experience, as many of the students had never previously engaged in ice skating.Additionally, next day they had an opportunity to stretch during yoga classes.
            </p>

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>

   <div class="site-content" id="content">
    <div class="elementor elementor-3" data-elementor-id="3" data-elementor-post-type="page" data-elementor-type="wp-page">
     <section class="elementor-section elementor-top-section elementor-element elementor-element-3e1a2e30 ot-traditional elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default" data-element_type="section" data-id="3e1a2e30">
      <div class="elementor-container elementor-column-gap-default">
       <div class="elementor-column elementor-col-100 elementor-top-column elementor-element elementor-element-35da7260 ot-flex-column-vertical" data-element_type="column" data-id="35da7260">
        <div class="elementor-widget-wrap elementor-element-populated">
         <div class="elementor-element elementor-element-7d9be60 elementor-widget elementor-widget-text-editor" data-element_type="widget" data-id="7d9be60" data-widget_type="text-editor.default">
          <div class="elementor-widget-container">
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            Who we are
           </h2>
           <p>
            Our website address is: http://emjm-sbbe.pl.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            Comments
           </h2>
           <p>
            When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.
           </p>
           <p>
            An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            Media
           </h2>
           <p>
            If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            Cookies
           </h2>
           <p>
            If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.
           </p>
           <p>
            If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.
           </p>
           <p>
            When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select “Remember Me”, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.
           </p>
           <p>
            If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            Embedded content from other websites
           </h2>
           <p>
            Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.
           </p>
           <p>
            These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            Who we share your data with
           </h2>
           <p>
            If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            How long we retain your data
           </h2>
           <p>
            If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.
           </p>
           <p>
            For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            What rights you have over your data
           </h2>
           <p>
            If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.
           </p>
           <h2 class="wp-block-heading">
            Where we send your data
           </h2>
           <p>
            Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
    </div>

                            const [k, v] = s.split('=')
                            return Object.assign(acc, {[k]: v})
                        }, {})

                        const url = "https://emjm-sbbe.eu/wp-json/apvc/track_view"
                        const body = {
                            utm_source: params.utm_source,

  <script>
   const lazyloadRunObserver = () => {
					const lazyloadBackgrounds = document.querySelectorAll( `.e-con.e-parent:not(.e-lazyloaded)` );
					const lazyloadBackgroundObserver = new IntersectionObserver( ( entries ) => {
						entries.forEach( ( entry ) => {
							if ( entry.isIntersecting ) {
								let lazyloadBackground = entry.target;
								if( lazyloadBackground ) {
									lazyloadBackground.classList.add( 'e-lazyloaded' );
								}
								lazyloadBackgroundObserver.unobserve( entry.target );
							}
						});
					}, { rootMargin: '200px 0px 200px 0px' } );
					lazyloadBackgrounds.forEach( ( lazyloadBackground ) => {
						lazyloadBackgroundObserver.observe( lazyloadBackground );
					} );
				};
				const events = [
					'DOMContentLoaded',
					'elementor/lazyload/observe',
				];
				events.forEach( ( event ) => {
					document.addEventListener( event, lazyloadRunObserver );
				} );
  </script>
